metadata.title: CVE-2020-9543 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
OpenStack Manila <7.4.1, >=8.0.0 <8.1.1, and >=9.0.0 <9.1.1 allows attackers to view, update, delete, or share resources that do not belong to them, because of a context-free lookup of a UUID. Attackers may also create resources, such as shared file systems and groups of shares on such share networks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-9543` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

manila-api - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
manila-common - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
manila-data - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
manila-scheduler - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
manila-share - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
python3-manila - 1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: manila package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.0.0~b3~git2020032516.cb016333-0ubuntu1').
